Let $W(3,k)$ be the van der Waerden number defined as the minimum $n$ such that in any red/blue colouring of $\{1,\ldots,n\}$ there exists either a red $3$-term arithmetic progression or a blue $k$-term arithmetic progression.

Give reasonable bounds for $W(3,k)$. In particular, give any non-trivial lower bounds for $W(3,k)$ and prove that $W(3,k) < \exp(k^c)$ for some constant $c<1$.



While we do not have a full understanding of the growth of $W(3,k)$, both of the specific challenges of Erd\H{o}s have been met.
Green \cite{Gr22} established the superpolynomial lower bound\[W(3,k) \geq \exp\left( c\frac{(\log k)^{4/3}}{(\log\log k)
^{1/3}}\right)\]for some constant $c>0$ (in particular disproving a conjecture of Graham that $W(3,k)\ll k^2$). Hunter \cite{Hu22} improved this to\[W(3,k) \geq \exp\left( c\frac{(\log k)^{2}}{\log\log k}\right).\]The first to show that $W(3,k) < \exp(k^c)$ for some $c<1$ was Schoen \cite{Sc21}. The best upper bound currently known is\[W(3,k) \ll \exp\left( O((\log k)^9)\right),\]which follows from the best bounds known for sets without three-term arithmetic progressions (see \cite{BlSi23} which improves slightly on the bounds due to Kelley and Meka \cite{KeMe23}).




References


[BlSi23] T. F. Bloom and O. Sisask, An improvement to the Kelley-Meka bounds on three-term arithmetic progressions. arXiv:2309.02353 (2023).

[Gr22] Green, Ben, New lower bounds for van der {W}aerden numbers. Forum Math. Pi (2022), Paper No. e18, 51.

[Hu22] Hunter, Zach, Improved lower bounds for van der {W}aerden numbers. Combinatorica (2022), 1231-1252.

[KeMe23] Kelley, Z. and Meka, R., Strong Bounds for 3-Progressions. arXiv:2302.05537 (2023).

[Sc21] Schoen, Tomasz, A subexponential upper bound for van der {W}aerden numbers
{$W(3, k)$}. Electron. J. Combin. (2021), Paper No. 2.34, 10.
